title: Reservoir Computing for Macroeconomic Forecasting with Mixed Frequency Data. (arXiv:2211.00363v2 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: Macroeconomic forecasting has recently started embracing techniques that can deal with large-scale datasets and series with unequal release periods. MIxed-DAta Sampling (MIDAS) and Dynamic Factor Models (DFM) are the two main state-of-the-art approaches that allow modeling series with non-homogeneous frequencies. We introduce a new framework called the Multi-Frequency Echo State Network (MFESN) based on a relatively novel machine learning paradigm called reservoir computing. Echo State Networks (ESN) are recurrent neural networks formulated as nonlinear state-space systems with random state coefficients where only the observation map is subject to estimation. MFESNs are considerably more efficient than DFMs and allow for incorporating many series, as opposed to MIDAS models, which are prone to the curse of dimensionality. translated_title: 基于混合频率数据的宏观经济预测中的水库计算
translated_abstract: 最近，宏观经济预测开始采用能够处理大规模数据集和不同发布时期系列的技术。MIDAS和DFM是两种允许建模具有非均匀频率的序列的主要现有方法。我们引入了一种新的框架，称为基于水库计算的多频回声状态网络（MFESN）。回声状态网络（ESN）是将递归神经网络公式化为具有随机状态系数的非线性状态空间系统的方法，其中只有观察映射受到估计。与MIDAS模型相反，MFESN要高效得多，允许纳入许多序列，而MIDAS模型容易受到维度诅咒。所有方法在针对美国GDP增长的广泛的多步预测练习中进行比较。我们发现，我们的MFESN模型在性能方面优于或可与其他方法相比，并提供了更好的美国GDP增长率的现货预测。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新的框架——基于水库计算的多频回声状态网络（MFESN），用于宏观经济预测中的混合频率数据，并证明MFESN模型在性能方面优于或可与现有方法相比，并提供了更好的美国GDP增长率的现货预测
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new framework called MFESN using reservoir computing for macroeconomic forecasting with mixed frequency data. The MFESN model is shown to outperform or be comparable to existing methods and provide better nowcasts of growth rates of US GDP.
